job_title: Technical Director in Palos Heights, IL
pros: I spent time working for both the Communication Arts Department and Audio / Visual Office in various roles. Both were considered part-time jobs, but were each easily around 25-30 hours of work a week. I adored the CommArts work as it was more in the field of work I wanted to do and was amazing to work with students and professors on their needs and goals for the department. I was a Trinity graduate as well so it was amazing to be back on campus and in their community as I truly adored being there.
cons: My job was given to a part-time faculty member when the school / department wanted to give him full-time status to keep him working there. At the time I was only working for the CommArts Department and had another full-time job so they said it was in the guise of finding someone who had more availability, but I was still putting in 25 - 30 hours a week easily for them and seemed like a slightly shady way to lay off an employee of 3 years.

pros: The classes are small in size so that the contact and relationships between the instructors and the students are close.
cons:
It is a very conservative Christian school which is very good for very conservative Christians.
It has a very strong tradition of a particular ethnic group. 
Most of the faculty, staff and students are from one ethnic group. 
If you are not in such an ethnic group, it is so difficult to work together.
No matter what your job title is, persons in such a group has more power.

review_title: Wonderful faculty and staff! A warm and kind place to work, which also allows one to grow spiritually.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Palos Heights, IL
pros: Beautiful campus, along with great faculty and staff! Everyone works as a cooperative, patient team. One also has the opportunity to participate in weekly chapel services during the work day on campus!
cons: The salary could be a bit better. Little opportunity to receive a pay raise. Despite this, I remain grateful for the environment!
